themes: Underutilization of public event spaces due to event caps
key_phrases: excessive fees and stipulations to book city-owned venues
non-negotiable to use catering options outside the exclusive in-house catering business
prices are congruent with those of a five-star hotel
prevent many smaller local organizations from being able to access and make use of these city-owned spaces
booking space at city-owned recreation centers costs more than $200 per hour
fees for additional staff, custodial services, and utilities are added at the discretion of the venue
rental rates higher than private venues in some cases
caps on the number of events that can be hosted
space lies vacant most of the year
blocks smaller organizations from accessing some of the most flexible and affordable city-owned spaces
barriers_identified: High rental costs for city-owned venues
Mandatory use of expensive in-house catering
Non-negotiable and excessive fees and stipulations
Event caps limiting access to certain spaces
Lack of access for smaller/local organizations
solutions_proposed: Allow outside catering options at city-owned venues
Reduce or make negotiable venue rental fees
Increase transparency and flexibility in additional fees
Remove or adjust event caps to allow more frequent use by smaller organizations
